intro: Cryptantha cana, commonly known as the pale cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cryptantha cana is often found in open grasslands and along the edges of woodlands.
